Title of the Notebook Example¶

In this notebook we demonstrate

  • task1
  • task2
  • task3

Notes: This note is optional. It can be used as NCI data collection access terms and conditions, or highlight other special requirements for the example.

  • Authors: FirstName1 LastName1, FirstName2 LastName2
  • Keywords: Domain keywords like in peer-reviewed journals
  • Software: tools and packages with versions used in this example
  • Create Date: 2020-Mar-15; Release Date: 2020-Mar-30; Update Date: 2020-Apr-30
  • Key updates: Critical changes (typo or minor changes do not need records)
  • Lineage/Reference: optional - reference to materials that this example is based on

prerequisite¶

To run this notebook on Gadi/VDI, or on your local computer. The following modules are needed:

  • Python3
  • Xarry

You also need to be a member of the following data project to access the data or through NCI’s data service if the data is published: * oi10

You can request to join the project through NCI’s user account management system.

Optional cell:¶

This section could be another introductory text to explain in more scientific and/or technical details what the example will do. It could also be used as a background blog to explain or link to techinical concepts which need to be referenced to somewhere else. For example, what are Pangeo, ESGF, MIPs.

Step 1¶

This first chunk of workflow in a sequencial order.

It might start with some linux command:

$ cd ~
$ ls -l

The commands above generate an image which is inserted here.

Step 2¶

In each section, you can futuer divide into several sub-section using more hash tag #.

step 2.1¶

Some text can be highlighted in colour, e.g., red.

step 2.2¶

Or you can make some text bold.

Step 3¶

If you want to post a warning message you can do this:

NOTE: The flag ‘–user’ is required so that the package is installed locally. If not included, permission errors will be returned.

If you want to emphasise something you can do this:

To test whether the install was successful, try: $ python >> import netCDF4 >> (If you get any errors, the install was unsuccessful.)

To add any tips or tricks, you can do this:

Tip: Try to use more than three hash in front of session title. Otherwise, font will appear in huge size.

Summary¶

In this example, we show how to do this and that. If you are interested, please follow this link for more information.
